label: def-single-swarm-space
nl_definition: A walker is a tuple combining position (and velocity in the Euclidean Gas) with survival status; a swarm is an N-tuple of such walker states, and the single-swarm state space is the Cartesian product of individual walker state spaces.

formal_conditions.text: A walker is a tuple (x, s) where x ∈ \mathcal{X} is position and s ∈ {0, 1} is survival status.
In the Euclidean Gas, the full state is (x, v, s) ∈ ℝ^d × ℝ^d × {0, 1}, with kinematic state (x, v).
A swarm configuration S is an N-tuple of walker states.
formal_conditions.latex: S := \left( (x_1, v_1, s_1), (x_2, v_2, s_2), \dots, (x_N, v_N, s_N) \right)

formal_conditions.text: The single-swarm state space Σ_N is the Cartesian product.

properties.name: Cartesian product structure
properties.description: The swarm state space is the product of individual walker state spaces, allowing independent variation of each walker's state.

properties.name: Finite dimensionality
properties.description: For fixed N and d, Σ_N is a finite-dimensional space with 2^N possible survival configurations.

parameters.name: number of walkers
parameters.description: The number of walkers in the swarm configuration

parameters.name: spatial dimension
parameters.description: The dimension of the position and velocity spaces in the Euclidean Gas

parameters.name: position space
parameters.description: General state space for walker position in the abstract Fragile Gas

notes.text: The definition is abstract for the Fragile Gas framework using general \mathcal{X}, but specialized to Euclidean Gas with velocity in ℝ^d.
The kinematic state (x, v) captures position and velocity, relevant for motion dynamics in the Euclidean case.

label: def-coupled-state-space
nl_definition: The Cartesian product of the state space Σ_N with itself, consisting of ordered pairs (S₁, S₂) where each S_i is a configuration of N particles with positions, velocities, and spins.

formal_conditions.text: S₁ ∈ Σ_N and S₂ ∈ Σ_N

properties.name: product structure
properties.description: Direct product of two identical state spaces for comparing trajectories

properties.name: element composition
properties.description: Pairs of N-tuples, each tuple containing position x, velocity v, and spin s for particles

notes.text: Used in synchronous coupling to minimize distance between trajectories; expectations taken w.r.t. shared randomness

label: def-state-difference-vectors
nl_definition: For a pair of swarm states (S₁, S₂) in Σ_N × Σ_N, the state difference vectors consist of the position difference Δx_i = x_{1,i} - x_{2,i} and velocity difference Δv_i = v_{1,i} - v_{2,i} for each walker i from 1 to N, each in ℝ^d.

formal_conditions.text: Position difference vector
Velocity difference vector

parameters.name: walker index
parameters.description: Index of the walker in the swarm

parameters.name: number of walkers
parameters.description: Total number of walkers in each swarm

parameters.name: spatial dimension
parameters.description: Dimension of the position and velocity spaces

label: def-barycentres-and-centered-vectors
nl_definition: For each swarm in a coupled state, the barycentres are the average positions and velocities computed only over alive walkers, and the centered vectors are the individual alive walkers' positions and velocities relative to these swarm barycentres.

properties.name: Sum to zero
properties.description: By construction, the centered vectors for alive walkers in any swarm sum to zero: \sum_{i \in \mathcal{A}(S_k)} \delta_{x,k,i} = 0 and \sum_{i \in \mathcal{A}(S_k)} \delta_{v,k,i} = 0.

properties.name: Alive walkers only
properties.description: Dead walkers do not contribute to the barycentres, variances, or any statistical quantities.

notes.text: Dead walkers (i \notin \mathcal{A}(S_k)) do not contribute to barycentres, variances, or any statistical quantities.

Dead walkers retain their last known position (x_i, v_i) but have status s_i = 0. Including them in statistical calculations would distort the geometric properties: (1) Physical Interpretation: Dead walkers represent "failed" exploration paths. Their positions are historical artifacts, not part of the current active swarm distribution. (2) Cloning Operator Target: The cloning operator \Psi_{\text{clone}} acts on the fitness and geometric distribution of alive walkers. The variance it contracts is specifically the variance of the alive population.

label: def-location-error-component
nl_definition: For any pair of swarm configurations with barycenters $(\mu_{x,1}, \mu_{v,1})$ and $(\mu_{x,2}, \mu_{v,2})$, the location error component $V_{\text{loc}}$ measures the hypocoercive quadratic error between the differences $\Delta\mu_x = \mu_{x,1} - \mu_{x,2}$ and $\Delta\mu_v = \mu_{v,1} - \mu_{v,2}$.

formal_conditions.text: Defined for pairs of swarm configurations $(S_1, S_2)$ with barycenters $(\mu_{x,1}, \mu_{v,1})$ and $(\mu_{x,2}, \mu_{v,2})$
$V_{\text{loc}} := \|\Delta\mu_x\|^2 + \lambda_v \|\Delta\mu_v\|^2 + b \langle \Delta\mu_x, \Delta\mu_v \rangle$ where $\Delta\mu_x = \mu_{x,1} - \mu_{x,2}$ and $\Delta\mu_v = \mu_{v,1} - \mu_{v,2}$

properties.name: permutation-invariant
properties.description: Invariant under permutations of particles within each swarm, as it depends only on the centers of mass.

notes.text: The distance between the swarms' centers of mass is an intrinsically permutation-invariant quantity. We define the location error as the hypocoercive quadratic form applied to the difference between the barycenters of the two swarms.

label: def-structural-error-component
nl_definition: The structural error component $V_{\text{struct}}$ is the squared hypocoercive Wasserstein distance between the centered empirical measures $\tilde{\mu}_1$ and $\tilde{\mu}_2$ of two swarms $S_1$ and $S_2$, computed over alive walkers only.

notes.text: The structural error measures the mismatch between the "shapes" of the two swarms. The shape of a swarm is described by the set of its centered vectors, $\{\delta_{z,k,i}\}$. To compare these shapes in a permutation-invariant way, we find the optimal matching between the centered vectors of the two swarms and measure the residual error of that matching. This is equivalent to the hypocoercive Wasserstein distance between the centered empirical measures.

label: def-full-synergistic-lyapunov-function
nl_definition: A permutation-invariant function measuring the combined inter-swarm distance, intra-swarm dispersion in position and velocity (over alive walkers, normalized by total swarm size N), and boundary proximity penalty for alive walkers in paired swarm configurations.

formal_conditions.text: Defined for swarm configurations (S₁, S₂) with empirical measures (μ₁, μ₂)
V_total(S₁, S₂) = W_h²(μ₁, μ₂) + c_V V_Var(S₁, S₂) + c_B W_b(S₁, S₂)
formal_conditions.latex: V_{\mathrm{total}}(S_1, S_2) := W_h^2(\mu_1, \mu_2) + c_V V_{Var}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)

formal_conditions.text: V_Var(S₁, S₂) = V_Var,x(S₁, S₂) + λ_v V_Var,v(S₁, S₂)
formal_conditions.latex: V_{Var}(S_1, S_2) = V_{Var,x}(S_1, S_2) + \lambda_v V_{Var,v}(S_1, S_2)

formal_conditions.text: W_b(S₁, S₂) = (1/N) ∑_{i ∈ A(S₁)} φ_barrier(x_{1,i}) + (1/N) ∑_{i ∈ A(S₂)} φ_barrier(x_{2,i})

properties.name: Inter-Swarm Error Component
properties.description: Squared hypocoercive 2-Wasserstein distance W_h²(μ₁, μ₂), decomposable into location (V_loc) and structural (V_struct) errors measuring permutation-invariant phase-space distance between swarms.

properties.name: Intra-Swarm Error Component
properties.description: Variance term V_Var capturing internal dispersion within each swarm, targeting synergistic contraction via cloning (positional) and kinetic (velocity) operators, summed over alive walkers and normalized by N.

properties.name: Boundary Potential Component
properties.description: Penalty term W_b using barrier function φ_barrier to discourage alive walkers from approaching boundaries, normalized by N and excluding dead walkers.

properties.name: Normalization
properties.description: All variance and boundary terms normalized by total swarm size N for analytical tractability in drift analysis, scaling with alive fraction k_alive/N.

parameters.name: velocity variance weight
parameters.description: Positive weighting factor for the velocity component in the intra-swarm variance.

parameters.name: variance coupling constant
parameters.description: Positive constant balancing the intra-swarm variance term in the Lyapunov function.

parameters.name: boundary coupling constant
parameters.description: Positive constant balancing the boundary potential term in the Lyapunov function.

parameters.name: hypocoercive parameter
parameters.description: Hypocoercive parameter used in the definition of the hypocoercive Wasserstein distance.

parameters.name: total swarm size
parameters.description: Fixed total number of walkers in each swarm, used for normalization.

notes.text: Normalization by N vs. k_alive: Uses total swarm size N for mathematical simplicity in expectations, avoiding ratios of random variables; interprets as mean-field disorder per walker slot, assuming viability with k_alive/N bounded away from zero via axioms and contractive properties.
W_h² decomposes per Lemma on Wasserstein decomposition; δ vectors from definition of barycenters and centered vectors; φ_barrier from barrier existence proposition.
Designed for hypocoercive drift analysis; parameters b, λ_v for hypocoercivity; c_V, c_B as small coupling constants for balancing in inequalities.

label: def-variance-conversions
nl_definition: Formulas defining and converting between three variance measures for a swarm k: the un-normalized sum of squared positional deviations S_k, the physical internal variance Var_k(x) normalized by the number of alive walkers, and the Lyapunov variance component V_{Var,x}(S_k) normalized by total walker slots N.

formal_conditions.text: Un-normalized Sum of Squared Deviations
Physical Internal Variance (k-normalized)
Lyapunov Variance Component (N-normalized)
Basic Conversion
From physical to Lyapunov
From Lyapunov to physical

properties.name: Un-normalized Sum of Squared Deviations
properties.description: Total positional variance without any normalization.

properties.name: Physical Internal Variance
properties.description: Average squared deviation per alive walker - the standard statistical variance.

properties.name: Lyapunov Variance Component
properties.description: Mean-field contribution to system disorder per walker slot.

parameters.name: Total walker slots
parameters.description: Total number of walker slots in the swarm

parameters.name: Number of alive walkers
parameters.description: Number of alive walkers in swarm k, equal to |A(S_k)|

parameters.name: Un-normalized Sum of Squared Deviations
parameters.description: Total positional variance without normalization

parameters.name: Physical Internal Variance
parameters.description: k-normalized average squared deviation per alive walker

parameters.name: Lyapunov Variance Component
parameters.description: N-normalized mean-field contribution to system disorder per walker slot

notes.text: When converting between notations in proofs: - From S_k to V_{Var,x}(S_k): divide by N - From Var_k(x) to V_{Var,x}(S_k): multiply by k_alive / N

label: def-algorithmic-distance-metric
nl_definition: The squared algorithmic distance between two walkers is the sum of the squared Euclidean norm of their position difference and a weighted squared Euclidean norm of their velocity difference.

formal_conditions.text: For any two walkers $i$ and $j$ with states $(x_i, v_i)$ and $(x_j, v_j)$

parameters.name: lambda_alg
parameters.description: Weighting factor for the velocity difference component in the algorithmic distance metric.

notes.text: This metric quantifies proximity between walkers and is central to intra-swarm measurements, including companion selection for diversity and cloning.

label: def-spatial-pairing-operator-diversity
nl_definition: An operator that maps the alive set of walkers to a probability distribution over all possible perfect matchings, where probabilities are assigned based on the product of edge weights computed from exponential decay of squared algorithmic distances between paired walkers, normalized by the partition function.

formal_conditions.text: Edge weight assignment
Quality of a matching M
Probability of selecting matching M
Input alive set size
Domain

properties.name: Inputs
properties.description: The alive set of walkers \mathcal{A}_t = \{w_1, w_2, \dots, w_k\} and \varepsilon_d > 0 (Interaction Range for Diversity).

properties.name: Output
properties.description: A probability distribution over the set of all possible perfect matchings \mathcal{M}_k.

properties.name: Weight Function
properties.description: Gaussian-like weight based on algorithmic distance d_{\text{alg}}(i,j).

properties.name: Normalization
properties.description: Probabilities sum to 1 via the partition function \sum_{M' \in \mathcal{M}_k} W(M').

parameters.name: Interaction Range for Diversity
parameters.description: The Interaction Range for Diversity.

notes.text: For the purposes of theoretical analysis, it is useful to model the pairing as a single, collective draw from a probability distribution over all possible perfect matchings of the alive set. This idealized model captures the physical intent of the operator—to strongly favor pairings between walkers that are close in the algorithmic space.

label: def-greedy-pairing-algorithm
nl_definition: An iterative stochastic algorithm that constructs a matching among alive walkers by sequentially selecting an unpaired walker, computing proximity-based probabilities over remaining unpaired walkers, sampling a companion, and updating the companion map until at most one walker remains unpaired.

formal_conditions.text: Initialize unpaired set U ← A_t and empty companion map c.
While |U| > 1: Select arbitrary i from U and remove it.
For each j in U, compute weight w_{ij} = exp(-d_alg(i, j)^2 / (2 ε_d^2)).
Form probability P(choose j) = w_{ij} / sum_{l in U} w_{il}.
Sample c_i from this distribution, remove c_i from U.
Set c(i) ← c_i and c(c_i) ← i.
Return companion map c.

properties.name: Output
properties.description: Generates a companion map c: A_t → A_t, a perfect matching if k even, or maximal matching if k odd.

properties.name: Complexity
properties.description: Reduces computational complexity from factorial to quadratic by iterative greedy selection.

properties.name: Stochasticity
properties.description: Companion selection is probabilistic based on proximity weights.

parameters.name: Set of Alive Walkers
parameters.description: The set of k alive walkers at time t.

parameters.name: Interaction Range for Diversity
parameters.description: Positive parameter controlling the scale of proximity in selection weights.

notes.text: This algorithm builds the matching iteratively. It selects an unpaired walker, computes a probability distribution over all other currently unpaired walkers based on proximity, samples a companion, and removes the new pair from the pool. This reduces the computational complexity from factorial to quadratic, making it practical for large swarms.

label: def-geometric-partition
nl_definition: A phase-space partitioning of a high-variance swarm (with Var(x) > R_var^2) into two non-empty N-uniform sets: a high-error set of kinematically isolated walkers and a low-error set forming dense local clusters, for a given interaction range ε.

formal_conditions.text: The swarm S satisfies Var(x) > R_var^2, where x denotes positions.
S is partitioned into non-empty, N-uniform sets H_k and L_k (disjoint union).
formal_conditions.latex: S = H_k \sqcup L_k, \, |H_k| \geq cN, \, |L_k| \geq cN \, (c > 0 \, N\text{-uniform})

formal_conditions.text: For H_k (high-error): exists D_H(ε) > 0 such that ∀ i ∈ H_k, ∀ j ≠ i, d_alg(i, j) > D_H(ε) (kinematically isolated).
formal_conditions.latex: \exists D_H(\varepsilon) > 0: \, \forall i \in H_k, \, \forall j \neq i, \, d_{\alg}(i,j) > D_H(\varepsilon)

formal_conditions.text: For L_k (low-error): ∀ j ∈ L_k, ∃ C_j ⊂ L_k non-empty with |C_j| ≥ f_c k (f_c > 0 N-uniform) s.t. all in C_j within algorithmic radius R_L(ε) < D_H(ε) from j.
formal_conditions.latex: \forall j \in L_k, \, \exists C_j \subset L_k, \, |C_j| \geq f_c k \, (f_c > 0 \, N\text{-uniform}), \, \forall i \in C_j, \, d_{\alg}(i,j) \leq R_L(\varepsilon) < D_H(\varepsilon)

properties.name: High-Error Set H_k
properties.description: Consists of kinematically isolated walkers, separated from all others by at least D_H(ε) in algorithmic distance.

properties.name: Low-Error Set L_k
properties.description: Consists of walkers each belonging to a dense local cluster of at least f_c k others within R_L(ε).

properties.name: N-Uniformity
properties.description: Both H_k and L_k are non-empty with sizes bounded below by a positive fraction of the total swarm size N.

properties.name: Phase-Space Basis
properties.description: Defined using local (cluster isolation) and global (variance) properties for interaction range ε.

parameters.name: interaction range
parameters.description: The given interaction range defining the swarm's phase-space structure.

parameters.name: variance threshold
parameters.description: Threshold determining high-variance state: Var(x) > R_{\var}^2.

parameters.name: set index
parameters.description: Index parameterizing the partitioned sets H_k and L_k.

parameters.name: cluster fraction
parameters.description: Positive N-uniform fraction bounding the minimum size of local clusters in L_k.

parameters.name: isolation distance
parameters.description: Positive distance ensuring kinematic isolation for members of H_k.

parameters.name: cluster radius
parameters.description: Algorithmic radius for dense clusters in L_k, smaller than the isolation distance.

notes.text: Existence guaranteed by cor-vvarx-to-high-error-fraction.
Full detailed proof provided in Chapter 6.
Applies to swarms in high-variance states based on phase-space structure.

label: def-raw-value-operators
nl_definition: Operators that deterministically measure raw reward and paired distance for alive walkers after fixing the companion map.

formal_conditions.text: The Reward Measurement Operator (V_R): The raw reward for each alive walker i is its direct, individual measurement of the reward function, which explicitly includes both positional and velocity components: r_i := R(x_i, v_i) = R_pos(x_i) - c_{v_reg} ||v_i||^2 where R_pos(x_i) is the positional reward and c_{v_reg} > 0 is the velocity regularization coefficient from Axiom EG-4.

The Paired Distance Measurement Operator (V_D): Given the Companion Map c(i) generated by the pairing operator, the raw distance for each alive walker i is deterministically defined as the algorithmic distance to its assigned companion: d_i := d_alg(i, c(i))

properties.name: Deterministic
properties.description: Measurements are deterministic once the companion map is fixed by the pairing operator.

properties.name: Individual
properties.description: Reward measurement is direct and individual for each walker, including position and velocity components.

properties.name: Paired
properties.description: Distance measurement uses the assigned companion from the map.

parameters.name: velocity regularization coefficient
parameters.description: Positive coefficient penalizing walker velocity in reward function

notes.text: Once the Companion Map c(i) is fixed for the timestep by the pairing operator, the measurement of raw values for each walker becomes a deterministic process.

label: def-swarm-aggregation-operator
nl_definition: An operator that processes raw reward and distance vectors from the k alive walkers to compute summary statistics, specifically the mean and standard deviation, for subsequent standardization.

parameters.name: k
parameters.description: The number of alive walkers providing the raw reward and distance vectors.

label: def-patched-std-dev-function
nl_definition: A C^1 smooth replacement for the standard square-root function, designed to be globally Lipschitz and bounded away from zero, defined piecewise in terms of the raw variance V.

parameters.name: minimum variance threshold
parameters.description: The lower bound threshold for variance to ensure stability.

parameters.name: standard deviation epsilon
parameters.description: Regularization parameter added to prevent zero or near-zero standard deviation.

parameters.name: smoothing polynomial
parameters.description: A C^1 smooth polynomial used for interpolation in the transition region.

label: def-standardization-operator
nl_definition: The N-Dimensional Standardization Operator, denoted z, maps a swarm state S, a raw value vector v, and an aggregation operator M to an N-dimensional vector of standardized Z-scores.

formal_conditions.text: Aggregate the alive components v_A to get a measure μ_v = M(S, v_A).
Compute the mean μ_A = E[μ_v] and the patched standard deviation σ'_A = σ'_patch(Var[μ_v]).
For each alive walker i, compute its Z-score: z_i = (v_i - μ_A) / σ'_A.

properties.name: Input Dependencies
properties.description: Relies on alive components from swarm state S and aggregation via M.

properties.name: Output Type
properties.description: Produces N-dimensional vector of Z-scores for alive walkers.

properties.name: Robustness
properties.description: Uses patched standard deviation for handling variance in robust statistics.

parameters.name: swarm state
parameters.description: The current state of the swarm, including information about alive components.

parameters.name: raw value vector
parameters.description: The N-dimensional vector of raw values for the walkers.

parameters.name: aggregation operator
parameters.description: The operator used to aggregate values from alive components.

notes.text: This operator uses the robust statistics from the previous stage to convert the raw value vectors into standardized Z-scores.

label: def-logistic-rescale
nl_definition: A function from the real numbers to the open interval (0, 2) given by the formula g_A(z) = 2 / (1 + e^{-z}).

formal_conditions.text: Domain and codomain

label: def-fitness-potential-operator
nl_definition: The Fitness Potential Operator Φ_pipeline maps a swarm state S and raw measurement vectors r and d to an N-dimensional fitness potential vector V_fit by computing Z-scores for rewards and diversity, rescaling them with a floor η, and combining via weighted powers using α and β.

formal_conditions.text: Compute reward Z-scores: z_r = z(S, r, R_agg)
Compute diversity Z-scores: z_d = z(S, d, M_D)
For each alive walker i, compute rescaled reward: r'_i := g_A(z_{r,i}) + η
For each alive walker i, compute rescaled diversity: d'_i := g_A(z_{d,i}) + η
For each alive walker i, combine: V_i := (d'_i)^β · (r'_i)^α

properties.name: Input Dependencies
properties.description: Depends on swarm state S for contextual Z-scoring and raw vectors r, d of dimension N.

properties.name: Output
properties.description: N-dimensional vector V_fit, with components defined only for alive walkers.

properties.name: Positivity
properties.description: Ensured by adding floor η to rescaled components before exponentiation.

parameters.name: Swarm State
parameters.description: The current state of the swarm, used in Z-score computations.

parameters.name: Reward Vector
parameters.description: Raw N-dimensional reward measurement vector.

parameters.name: Diversity Vector
parameters.description: Raw N-dimensional diversity measurement vector.

parameters.name: Reward Aggregation
parameters.description: Aggregation parameter for reward Z-score computation.

parameters.name: Diversity Metric
parameters.description: Metric parameter for diversity Z-score computation.

parameters.name: Floor Value
parameters.description: Minimum additive value for rescaled components to ensure positivity.

parameters.name: Reward Weight
parameters.description: Exponent weighting the reward component in the final combination.

parameters.name: Diversity Weight
parameters.description: Exponent weighting the diversity component in the final combination.

notes.text: Computations are performed only for alive walkers in the swarm; dead walkers may have V_i = 0 or undefined.
Relies on prior definitions of Z-score function z and rescaling function g_A.

label: def-cloning-companion-operator
nl_definition: An operator that, for each walker i in a swarm state S, defines a probability measure C_i(S) to sample a companion c_i independently, using phase-space-aware softmax selection for alive walkers or uniform selection over alive walkers for dead walkers, parameterized by interaction range ε_c.

formal_conditions.latex: If i \in \mathcal{A}_k: P(c_i = j \mid i \in \mathcal{A}_k) := \frac{\exp\left(-\frac{d_{\text{alg}}(i, j)^2}{2\epsilon_c^2}\right)}{\sum_{l \in \mathcal{A}_k \setminus \{i\}} \exp\left(-\frac{d_{\text{alg}}(i, l)^2}{2\epsilon_c^2}\right)}, \quad \forall j \in \mathcal{A}_k \setminus \{i\}
If i \in \mathcal{D}_k: P(c_i = j \mid i \in \mathcal{D}_k) := \frac{1}{k}, \quad \forall j \in \mathcal{A}_k

properties.name: Inputs
properties.description: Swarm state S (defining \mathcal{A}_k and \mathcal{D}_k) and interaction range \varepsilon_c > 0.

properties.name: Operation for alive walkers
properties.description: Phase-space-aware selection via softmax on algorithmic distances to other alive walkers.

properties.name: Operation for dead walkers
properties.description: Uniform random selection from all k alive walkers.

properties.name: Independence
properties.description: Companions c_i are sampled independently for each i.

parameters.name: swarm state
parameters.description: Current state of the swarm, defining alive and dead walkers.

parameters.name: interaction range
parameters.description: Positive parameter controlling the cloning interaction range.

parameters.name: walker index
parameters.description: Index of the walker for which the companion is selected.

parameters.name: number of alive walkers
parameters.description: Size of the set of alive walkers A_k.

label: def-cloning-score
nl_definition: Once a companion c_i has been selected for walker i, the Canonical Cloning Score S_i(c_i) is calculated as the normalized difference between the fitness of the companion and the walker, adjusted by a small epsilon term.

formal_conditions.text: Definition formula

parameters.name: cloning_score
parameters.description: The canonical cloning score for walker i and companion c_i

parameters.name: companion_fitness
parameters.description: Fitness value of the selected companion c_i

parameters.name: walker_fitness
parameters.description: Fitness value of walker i

parameters.name: clone_epsilon
parameters.description: Small epsilon parameter for cloning to avoid division by zero

label: def-cloning-probability
nl_definition: The total cloning probability p_i for a walker i is its unconditional probability of being marked for cloning, computed as the expectation over the random selection of companion c_i and threshold T_i.

formal_conditions.text: p_i := E_{c_i ~ C_i(S)} [ P_{T_i ~ U(0, p_max)} ( S_i(c_i) > T_i ) ]
p_i = E_{c_i ~ C_i(S)} [ min(1, max(0, S_i(c_i) / p_max )) ]

properties.name: unconditional probability
properties.description: Marginalizes over companion selection and threshold randomness

properties.name: bounded
properties.description: Always satisfies 0 ≤ p_i ≤ 1 due to min-max clipping

parameters.name: total cloning probability
parameters.description: Unconditional probability of walker i being marked for cloning

parameters.name: walker index
parameters.description: Identifier for the walker

parameters.name: companion
parameters.description: Randomly selected companion for walker i

parameters.name: score
parameters.description: Score of companion c_i for walker i

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: Random threshold drawn from uniform distribution

parameters.name: maximum probability
parameters.description: Upper bound for the threshold distribution

notes.text: The inner probability for a fixed companion evaluates to min(1, max(0, S_i(c_i)/p_max))
Represents the expected cloning rate for walker i across possible companions and thresholds

label: def-cloning-decision
nl_definition: A decision mechanism involving stochastic cloning, as introduced in section 5.7.3.

notes.text: The directive appears incomplete; no formal definition body is provided.

label: def-inelastic-collision-update
nl_definition: A simultaneous, momentum-conserving update for groups of cloners selecting the same companion, resetting cloner positions with jitter and applying an inelastic velocity collapse with tunable restitution to control kinetic energy dissipation.

properties.name: Momentum Conservation
properties.description: The total momentum of the (M+1)-particle interacting system is conserved through the center-of-mass velocity.

properties.name: Position Jitter
properties.description: Cloners' positions are reset to the companion's position plus independent Gaussian noise.

properties.name: Tunable Dissipation
properties.description: Internal kinetic energy reduced by factor α_restitution², allowing control over velocity variance expansion.

properties.name: Uninvolved Walkers
properties.description: Walkers not participating in cloning remain unchanged.

parameters.name: coefficient of restitution
parameters.description: Fixed algorithmic parameter in [0,1] representing the coefficient of restitution, controlling energy dissipation in the inelastic collapse.

notes.text: If α_restitution = 1, perfectly elastic collision: magnitudes of relative velocities preserved, kinetic energy conserved, but velocity reset causes bounded variance expansion.
If α_restitution = 0, perfectly inelastic: all walkers in group get identical V_{COM,c} velocity, maximizing dissipation of internal kinetic energy.
For α_restitution ∈ (0,1), intermediate dissipation: internal kinetic energy reduced by α_restitution², balancing kinetic diversity and variance control.

label: def-unified-high-low-error-sets
term: Unified High-Error Set H_k(ε) and Low-Error Set L_k(ε)
nl_definition: A partition of the alive set A_k into a high-error set H_k(ε), consisting of walkers in small invalid clusters or outlier clusters with high phase-space variance contribution, and a complementary low-error set L_k(ε), constructed via hierarchical clustering on phase-space distances with statistical validity and outlier detection.

formal_conditions.text: Partition A_k into clusters {G_1, ..., G_M} using complete-linkage hierarchical clustering with max diameter D_diam(ε) = c_d · ε, where diam(G_m) = max_{i,j ∈ G_m} d_alg(i,j) ≤ D_diam(ε) and d_alg(i,j)^2 = ||x_i - x_j||^2 + λ_alg ||v_i - v_j||^2.
formal_conditions.latex: Partition $\mathcal{A}_k$ into clusters $\{G_1, \ldots, G_M\}$ using complete-linkage hierarchical clustering with max diameter $D_{\text{diam}}(\epsilon) = c_d \cdot \epsilon$, where $\text{diam}(G_m) = \max_{i,j \in G_m} d_{\text{alg}}(i, j) \le D_{\text{diam}}(\epsilon)$ and $d_{\text{alg}}(i, j)^2 := \|x_i - x_j\|^2 + \lambda_{\text{alg}} \|v_i - v_j\|^2$.

formal_conditions.text: Impose minimum cluster size k_min = max(5, ⌈0.05k⌉); clusters with |G_m| < k_min are invalid and their walkers go to H_k(ε).
formal_conditions.latex: Impose minimum cluster size $k_{\min} := \max(5, \lceil 0.05k \rceil)$; clusters with $|G_m| < k_{\min}$ are invalid.

formal_conditions.text: For valid clusters (|G_m| ≥ k_min), compute center (μ_{x,m}, μ_{v,m}) and Contrib(G_m) = |G_m| (||μ_{x,m} - μ_x||^2 + λ_v ||μ_{v,m} - μ_v||^2), where (μ_x, μ_v) is global center. Identify outlier indices O_M such that sum_{m ∈ O_M} Contrib(G_m) ≥ (1 - ε_O) total valid contribution.
formal_conditions.latex: For valid clusters, compute $\text{Contrib}(G_m) := |G_m| \left(\||\mu_{x,m} - \mu_x\|^2 + \lambda_v \||\mu_{v,m} - \mu_v\|^2\right)$. Identify $O_M$ s.t. $\sum_{m \in O_M} \text{Contrib}(G_m) \ge (1-\varepsilon_O) \sum_{\substack{m=1 \ |G_m| \ge k_{\min}}}^M \text{Contrib}(G_m)$.

formal_conditions.text: H_k(ε) = union of G_m for m ∈ O_M and invalid m; L_k(ε) = A_k \ H_k(ε).

properties.name: Partition Property
properties.description: H_k(ε) and L_k(ε) form a partition of A_k: disjoint and their union is A_k.

properties.name: Unified Approach
properties.description: Applies consistently across all interaction regimes, capturing global outliers and local clustering via phase-space measures.

properties.name: Statistical Validity
properties.description: Invalid small clusters (|G_m| < k_min) are treated as high-error to ensure reliable statistics.

properties.name: Outlier Detection
properties.description: Based on hypocoercive variance contribution, selecting clusters covering (1 - ε_O) of total valid contribution.

parameters.name: swarm index
parameters.description: Index of the swarm step

parameters.name: error parameter
parameters.description: Threshold parameter controlling cluster diameter and error scale

parameters.name: diameter constant
parameters.description: Fixed constant scaling the maximum cluster diameter D_diam(ε)

parameters.name: minimum cluster size
parameters.description: Minimum size for statistically valid clusters, defined as max(5, ⌈0.05k⌉)

parameters.name: outlier fraction parameter
parameters.description: Structural parameter determining the fraction of total contribution for outlier clusters

parameters.name: algorithmic velocity weight
parameters.description: Weight parameter in the phase-space distance d_alg

parameters.name: variance velocity weight
parameters.description: Weight parameter in the contribution variance calculation

notes.text: The clustering uses complete-linkage hierarchical method for phase-space partitioning.
Constants like c_d=2, ε_O=0.1 are typical; λ_alg and λ_v are fixed algorithmic parameters.
Links swarm state to algorithm signals via global kinematic dispersion and local phase-space density.

label: def-max-patched-std
nl_definition: The maximum value that the patched standard deviation function can attain over its entire possible input domain.

formal_conditions.text: σ'_max := sup_{0 ≤ V ≤ V_max^2} σ'_patch(V)

properties.name: upper bound
properties.description: provides a uniform upper bound on the patched standard deviation σ'_patch(V) for all admissible V in [0, V_max^2]

parameters.name: V_max
parameters.description: uniform upper bound on a raw measurement's absolute value (either V_{\max}^{(R)} for rewards or D_{\text{valid}} for distances)

notes.text: This definition establishes a uniform upper bound on the patched standard deviation for use in the denominator of the standardization formula.

label: def-unfit-set
nl_definition: The unfit set of a swarm is the subset of its alive walkers whose individual fitness potentials are at most the swarm's average fitness potential.

formal_conditions.text: where \mu_{V,k} = \frac{1}{k} \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}_k} V_{k,j}

parameters.name: swarm index
parameters.description: Identifier for the swarm.

parameters.name: alive set
parameters.description: The set of alive walkers in swarm k.

parameters.name: fitness potential
parameters.description: Fitness potential of walker i in swarm k.

parameters.name: mean fitness potential
parameters.description: Average fitness potential across alive walkers in swarm k, defined as \frac{1}{k} \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}_k} V_{k,j}.

notes.text: Used in proofs involving fitness distribution imbalances in swarms.

label: def-critical-target-set
nl_definition: For a state in the high-error regime, with k the index of the high-variance swarm, the critical target set I_target is the set of walkers that are simultaneously stably alive in both swarms, unfit in swarm k, and high-error in swarm k.

formal_conditions.text: I_target := I_11 ∩ U_k ∩ H_k(ε)

properties.name: intersection
properties.description: intersection of sets of stably alive walkers (I_11), unfit walkers (U_k), and high-error walkers (H_k(ε))

parameters.name: swarm index
parameters.description: index of the high-variance swarm
constraints: k is the index for the high-variance swarm in the high-error regime

parameters.name: error parameter
parameters.description: parameter defining the high-error threshold in H_k

notes.text: This set represents walkers that are alive in both swarms (contributing to contractive force), unfit (targeted for cloning), and high-error (source of the problem), concentrating the corrective cloning action.

label: def-cloning-operator-formal
nl_definition: A stochastic operator that maps a swarm configuration with at least one alive walker to a probability distribution over new all-alive swarm configurations, defined as the composition of measure, fitness, decision, and update sub-operators.

formal_conditions.text: Input requires at least one alive walker
Output configurations have all walkers alive
Operator composition

properties.name: Domain
properties.description: Swarm configurations $S \in \Sigma_N$ with $|\mathcal{A}(S)| \geq 1$

properties.name: Range
properties.description: Probability measures on all-alive configurations in $\Sigma_N$

properties.name: Stochastic Structure
properties.description: Composition of deterministic and stochastic sub-operators

properties.name: All-Alive Output
properties.description: By construction, all output walkers have status $s'_i = 1$

notes.text: The operator ensures all output configurations are intermediate all-alive states.

label: def-measurement-operator
nl_definition: A stochastic operator that takes a swarm configuration S and outputs an N-dimensional raw distance vector d by sampling a spatially-aware pairing of alive agents and computing algorithmic distances along the pairing, setting distances to zero for dead agents.

formal_conditions.text: Input: Swarm configuration S with alive set A(S) of size k = |A(S)|.
Sample a pairing π: A(S) → A(S) from the spatially-aware random pairing distribution.
For each alive walker i ∈ A(S), compute d_i = d_alg(x_i, x_π(i)).
For dead walkers i ∉ A(S), set d_i = 0 deterministically.
Output: The N-dimensional raw distance vector d = (d_1, …, d_N) ∈ R^N_{≥0}.

properties.name: Correlated Measurements
properties.description: The pairing π is sampled once per swarm, creating correlations between measurements.

properties.name: Distribution Dependency
properties.description: The distribution of d depends only on S and the algorithmic parameters (ε_p, ℓ_p).

parameters.name: Swarm
parameters.description: Input swarm configuration with alive set A(S) of size k

parameters.name: epsilon_p
parameters.description: Algorithmic parameter for pairing distribution

parameters.name: ell_p
parameters.description: Algorithmic parameter for pairing distribution

label: def-fitness-operator
nl_definition: A deterministic operator that transforms a swarm configuration and raw distance vector into a fitness potential vector by computing boundary proximity rewards, applying rescaling and z-score normalization over alive walkers, and combining normalized components with dynamics weights.

formal_conditions.text: Input: Swarm configuration S and raw distance vector d ∈ ℝ^N_{≥0}
Compute raw rewards r_i = g_A(x_i) = φ_barrier(x_i) for each walker i, yielding r = (r_1, …, r_N)
Rescale: \tilde{d}_i = d_i + η, \tilde{r}_i = r_i + η
Z-score over alive walkers i ∈ A(S): means \bar{d}, \bar{r} and std devs σ_d, σ_r with k = |A(S)|
Z-scores for alive: z_{d,i} = (\tilde{d}_i - \bar{d}) / (σ_d + σ_stab), similarly for z_{r,i}; zero for dead
Rescaled components: r'_i = g_A(z_{r,i}) + η, d'_i = g_A(z_{d,i}) + η
Fitness: V_{fit,i} = (d'_i)^β · (r'_i)^α if alive, else 0
Output: V_{fit} = (V_{fit,1}, …, V_{fit,N}) ∈ ℝ^N_{≥0}

properties.name: Deterministic
properties.description: The operator produces the same output given fixed inputs S and d

properties.name: Bounded
properties.description: For alive walkers, V_{fit,i} ∈ [0, V_{pot,max}] where V_{pot,max} = (g_{A,max} + η)^{α+β}

properties.name: Alive-Only Normalization
properties.description: Empirical statistics computed exclusively over alive walkers A(S)

parameters.name: Swarm Configuration
parameters.description: Current state of the swarm including walker positions and alive status

parameters.name: Raw Distance Vector
parameters.description: Vector of non-negative raw distances for N walkers

parameters.name: Floor Parameter
parameters.description: Positive additive floor for rescaling to avoid zero or negative values

parameters.name: Stability Constant
parameters.description: Small positive constant added to standard deviations for numerical stability

parameters.name: Reward Weight
parameters.description: Exponent weight for the rescaled reward component in fitness potential

parameters.name: Distance Weight
parameters.description: Exponent weight for the rescaled distance component in fitness potential

notes.text: Dead walkers receive zero fitness potential, ensuring selection favors alive ones
Requires predefined functions g_A and φ_barrier, as well as system parameters η, σ_stab, α, β

label: def-decision-operator
nl_definition: A stochastic process that assigns companions to walkers in a swarm based on their status and computes cloning scores from fitness differences, then decides cloning or persistence via threshold comparison, producing companion and action vectors.

formal_conditions.text: For alive walker i, companion c_i sampled from softmax over other alive walkers using algorithmic distances.
For dead walker i, companion c_i sampled uniformly from alive walkers.
Cloning score S_i computed as normalized fitness difference.
Decision: Sample T_i ~ Uniform(0, p_max); clone if S_i > T_i, else persist.
formal_conditions.latex: a_i = \text{clone if } S_i > T_i, \text{ else persist}

formal_conditions.text: Total cloning probability p_i averages over companion and threshold randomness.

properties.name: Input
properties.description: Swarm configuration S and fitness potential vector V_fit

properties.name: Output
properties.description: Companion assignment vector c and binary action vector a indicating clone or persist for each walker

properties.name: Stochastic Elements
properties.description: Companion selection via softmax or uniform, and independent uniform threshold sampling for decisions

properties.name: Key Quantity
properties.description: Total cloning probability p_i for each walker, used in drift analysis

parameters.name: Swarm configuration
parameters.description: Current state of the swarm including positions and statuses of walkers

parameters.name: Fitness potential vector
parameters.description: Vector of fitness potentials V_fit,i for each walker i

parameters.name: Companion selection scale
parameters.description: Scale parameter for the softmax distribution in companion selection

parameters.name: Cloning epsilon
parameters.description: Small positive constant to avoid division by zero in cloning score

parameters.name: Maximum cloning probability
parameters.description: Upper bound for the uniform threshold sampling

notes.text: The operator processes each walker independently but with shared randomness in companion selection probabilities.
The total probability p_i is the expected cloning rate conditional on current swarm state and fitnesses, essential for analyzing population drift.

label: def-update-operator
nl_definition: An operator that updates a swarm's positions, velocities, and statuses based on cloning and persistence actions, involving deterministic grouping of cloners, stochastic position jittering with Gaussian noise, momentum-conserving inelastic collisions for velocities without jitter, and setting all output statuses to alive.

formal_conditions.text: Deterministic Grouping: For each unique companion j in \mathcal{A}(S), identify cloners I_j = {i : a_i = clone and c_i = j}, with M_j = |I_j|.
formal_conditions.latex: I_j := \{i \in \{1, \ldots, N\} : a_i = \text{clone} \text{ and } c_i = j\}, \quad M_j = |I_j|

formal_conditions.text: Position Updates for Cloners: For each i in I_j, x'_i = x_j + \sigma_x \zeta_i^x where \zeta_i^x \sim \mathcal{N}(0, I_d); companion x'_j = x_j.
Velocity Updates - Center-of-Mass: V_{COM,j} = 1/(M_j + 1) (v_j + \sum_{i \in I_j} v_i).
Velocity Updates - Relative Velocities: For k in I_j \cup {j}, u_k = v_k - V_{COM,j}; u'_k = \alpha_{restitution} \cdot R_k(u_k) where R_k is random orthogonal transformation preserving magnitude.
Velocity Updates - Lab Frame: v'_k = V_{COM,j} + u'_k.
Persisting Walkers: For a_i = persist, x'_i = x_i, v'_i = v_i.
Status Update: s'_i = 1 for all i in {1, ..., N}.

properties.name: Deterministic Grouping
properties.description: Groups cloners by unique companions before updates.

properties.name: Stochastic Position Jitter
properties.description: Adds Gaussian noise to cloner positions relative to companion, with scale \sigma_x.

properties.name: Inelastic Collision Model
properties.description: Updates velocities via momentum conservation, restitution coefficient \alpha_{restitution}, and random orthogonal rotations, without velocity jitter.

properties.name: Persistence
properties.description: Unchanged positions and velocities for persisting walkers.

properties.name: Universal Alive Status
properties.description: All output walkers are set to alive status.

parameters.name: Swarm configuration
parameters.description: Current state of the swarm including positions x, velocities v, and statuses s for N walkers.

parameters.name: Companion vector
parameters.description: Vector assigning each walker i a companion j in \mathcal{A}(S) for cloning actions.

parameters.name: Action vector
parameters.description: Vector specifying actions for each walker i, such as 'clone' or 'persist'.

notes.text: No Gaussian jitter is added to velocities; only positions receive jitter during cloning.
Parameters like \sigma_x (jitter scale) and \alpha_{restitution} (restitution coefficient) are assumed defined elsewhere.

label: def-key-operator-outputs
nl_definition: Central quantities in the drift analysis for a swarm S and its output S' under the cloning operator Ψ_clone, including cloning probabilities, position displacements, velocity perturbations, and centered displacements for coupled swarms.

formal_conditions.text: Total Cloning Probability for each walker i
Position Displacement for each walker i
formal_conditions.latex: $$\Delta x_i := x'_i - x_i$$ For cloners, $$\Delta x_i = x_{c_i} - x_i + \sigma_x \zeta_i^x$$ where $\zeta_i^x \sim \mathcal{N}(0, I_d)$.

formal_conditions.text: Velocity Perturbation for each walker i in cloning event
formal_conditions.latex: $$\Delta v_i := v'_i - v_i$$ Expected squared change depends on $\mathbb{E}[\|V_{\text{COM},j} - v_i\|^2]$, $\alpha_{\text{restitution}}$, and $R_i$.

formal_conditions.text: Centered Displacements for coupled swarms (S_1, S_2)

properties.name: Dependence on Swarm State
properties.description: All quantities depend on the input swarm S and its walker positions/velocities.

properties.name: Stochastic Elements
properties.description: Incorporate random variables like ζ_i^x ~ N(0, I_d) and random rotations R_i.

properties.name: Coupling Relevance
properties.description: Centered displacements apply specifically to paired swarms for comparative analysis.

parameters.name: Total Cloning Probability
parameters.description: Probability that walker i clones given the input swarm S

parameters.name: Position Displacement
parameters.description: Change in position for walker i, specifically for cloners Δx_i = x_{c_i} - x_i + σ_x ζ_i^x where ζ_i^x ~ N(0, I_d)

parameters.name: Velocity Perturbation
parameters.description: Change in velocity for walker i participating in cloning, from inelastic collision depending on center-of-mass shift, restitution coefficient α_restitution, and random rotation R_i

parameters.name: Centered Displacements
parameters.description: Difference in position displacements for coupled swarms (S_1, S_2): δ_{x,1,i} - δ_{x,2,i}

notes.text: These quantities are used in subsequent drift analysis for swarm evolution under cloning.

label: def-coupled-cloning-expectation
nl_definition: The expected value of a function f applied to the output swarms (S'_1, S'_2) obtained by independently applying the cloning operation Ψ_clone to input swarms (S_1, S_2), where all sources of randomness in the cloning processes are synchronously coupled.

formal_conditions.text: Same PRNG seeds for companion selection
Same pairing algorithm random choices
Same threshold samples T_i for each walker index i
Same Gaussian jitters ζ_i^x for position updates (when both walkers clone)
Same rotation operators R_i for velocity collisions (when both walkers participate in collisions)

parameters.name: first swarm
parameters.description: A swarm in the coupled state space.

parameters.name: second swarm
parameters.description: A swarm in the coupled state space.

parameters.name: test function
parameters.description: A function f: Σ_N × Σ_N → ℝ.

label: def-boundary-potential-recall
nl_definition: The boundary potential is the average value of a smooth barrier function applied to the states of agents in two swarms, promoting safety by penalizing proximity to the boundary of the valid state space.

formal_conditions.text: Interior safety: \varphi_{\text{barrier}}(x) = 0 for x in the safe interior region (distance > \delta_{\text{safe}} from boundary)
Boundary growth: \varphi_{\text{barrier}}(x) \to \infty as x \to \partial \mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}
Smoothness: \varphi_{\text{barrier}} \in C^2(\mathcal{X}_{\text{valid}}) with bounded derivatives in the interior

properties.name: Non-negativity
properties.description: W_b(S_1, S_2) \geq 0 due to \varphi_{\text{barrier}} \geq 0

properties.name: Averaged sum
properties.description: Computed as average over agents in each swarm

properties.name: Recall definition
properties.description: Component of the full synergistic Lyapunov function

parameters.name: S_1
parameters.description: State of the first swarm

parameters.name: S_2
parameters.description: State of the second swarm

parameters.name: N
parameters.description: Number of agents in each swarm

parameters.name: varphi_barrier
parameters.description: Smooth barrier function mapping valid states to non-negative reals

parameters.name: A(S_1)
parameters.description: Set of agent indices in swarm S_1

parameters.name: x_{1,i}
parameters.description: State of the i-th agent in S_1

parameters.name: x_{2,i}
parameters.description: State of the i-th agent in S_2

parameters.name: delta_safe
parameters.description: Safety distance threshold from boundary

parameters.name: X_valid
parameters.description: Valid state space

parameters.name: partial X_valid
parameters.description: Boundary of the valid state space

notes.text: This definition is recalled from the full synergistic Lyapunov function for context in the barrier analysis.

label: def-boundary-exposed-set
nl_definition: The boundary-exposed set of a swarm is the collection of its alive walkers whose barrier penalty exceeds a specified positive threshold, signaling dangerous proximity to the boundary; associated is the boundary-exposed mass, averaging these penalties normalized by the total number of walkers.

formal_conditions.text: The boundary-exposed set
The boundary-exposed mass

properties.name: membership condition
properties.description: An index i belongs to the set if it is an alive walker and its barrier penalty φ_barrier(x_i) > φ_thresh

properties.name: mass computation
properties.description: Average barrier penalty over exposed walkers, normalized by total walker count N

parameters.name: swarm
parameters.description: The swarm of walkers

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: Positive threshold for barrier penalty

notes.text: These are alive walkers whose barrier penalty exceeds the threshold, indicating dangerous proximity to the boundary.

label: def-mean-field-phase-space
nl_definition: The single-particle phase space Ω is the Cartesian product of a bounded convex position domain with a C² boundary and a closed ball of allowed velocities, representing all possible kinematic states of a particle under the constraints of the Euclidean Gas algorithm.

formal_conditions.text: X_valid is a bounded, convex subset of R^d with a C^2 boundary.
V_alg is the closed ball of allowed velocities with radius V_alg.
The phase space Ω is the Cartesian product.

properties.name: complete kinematic states
properties.description: encompasses all possible positions and velocities for a particle

properties.name: algorithmic constraints
properties.description: directly translates the position and velocity limits from the discrete Euclidean Gas algorithm

parameters.name: dimension
parameters.description: the dimension of the ambient Euclidean space

parameters.name: velocity bound
parameters.description: the maximum magnitude of allowed velocities in the algorithm

notes.text: The single-particle phase space defines the complete set of possible kinematic states—position and velocity—that a particle can occupy.
Properties are a direct, faithful translation of the constraints imposed on the walkers in the discrete Euclidean Gas algorithm, as defined in the Euclidean Gas specification (Chapter 2, Sec. 1.1).

label: def-phase-space-density
nl_definition: A non-negative function f on time and phase space that represents the continuous density of probability mass for alive particles, where its integral over subsets gives the expected fraction of alive walkers in those regions, with total alive mass at most 1.

formal_conditions.text: For measurable A ⊆ Ω, alive mass in A is ∫_A f(t, z) dz ≥ 0
Total alive mass m_a(t) = ∫_Ω f(t, x, v) dx dv ≤ 1
Dead mass m_d(t) = 1 - m_a(t)
Total mass conserved: m_a(t) + m_d(t) = 1

properties.name: Non-negativity
properties.description: f(t, z) ≥ 0 for all t ≥ 0, z ∈ Ω, ensuring probabilities are non-negative.

properties.name: Sub-probability
properties.description: The total integral over Ω is at most 1, accounting for possible mass loss to death.

properties.name: Mass Interpretation
properties.description: Integrals over subsets A yield the expected fraction of alive walkers in A.

properties.name: Conservation
properties.description: The sum of alive and dead masses remains 1 throughout evolution.

parameters.name: phase-space sub-probability density
parameters.description: Non-negative function describing the density of alive walkers in phase space at time t
constraints: ∫_A f(t, z) dz ≥ 0 for measurable A ⊆ Ω

parameters.name: single-particle phase space
parameters.description: The phase space for individual particles

parameters.name: total alive mass
parameters.description: Total probability mass of alive walkers at time t
constraints: m_a(t) = ∫_Ω f(t, x, v) dx dv

parameters.name: dead mass
parameters.description: Probability mass of dead walkers at time t

examples.text: Just as integrating a city's population density over a neighborhood gives the number of people living there, integrating f over a region of phase space gives the fraction of alive walkers expected to be in that region.

notes.text: The system's evolution is governed by a coupled PDE for f(t, z) and ODE for m_d(t), preserving total mass.
This density tracks the alive population's probability cloud in phase space, rather than individual walkers.

label: def-mean-field-moments
nl_definition: Functionals of the phase-space density f that compute the mean and variance of rewards and pairwise distances with respect to the normalized alive population density f / m_a(t).

formal_conditions.text: f(t, ·) is the phase-space density with total alive mass m_a(t) = ∫_Ω f(t,z) dz > 0
Normalization uses the density f(t,z) / m_a(t) to mimic averaging over alive walkers in the N-particle system

properties.name: Reward Moments
properties.description: Mean μ_R[f](t) and variance σ_R²[f](t) of the reward function R(z) under the normalized density f(t,z) / m_a(t).

properties.name: Distance Moments
properties.description: Mean μ_D[f](t) and variance σ_D²[f](t) of the distance d_Y(φ(z), φ(z')) between two independent draws from the normalized density f(t,z) / m_a(t).

parameters.name: phase-space density
parameters.description: The phase-space density f(t, ·) at time t, with total alive mass m_a(t) = ∫_Ω f(t,z) dz

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time parameter at which the density is evaluated

parameters.name: total alive mass
parameters.description: The integral of f over the phase space Ω

notes.text: These moments emphasize dependence on the shape of f via the notation μ[f], and replace discrete sums over alive walkers in the N-particle system with integrals in the mean-field limit.
Normalization by m_a(t) ensures the mean-field model faithfully limits the empirical statistics of the finite N-particle system averaged over k alive walkers.

label: def-mean-field-patched-std
nl_definition: Functionals of the density f that apply a regularization to the mean-field variance functionals to produce regularized standard deviations, ensuring numerical stability when variances approach zero.

properties.name: Preserves Stability
properties.description: Prevents denominators in standardization from approaching zero, especially in highly converged swarms where true variance is near zero.

properties.name: Continuity Guarantee
properties.description: Translates regularization mechanism from N-particle to mean-field level for consistent continuity properties.

parameters.name: density
parameters.description: Probability density function on which the functionals are defined.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Time parameter for the time-dependent functionals.

parameters.name: regularized std function
parameters.description: Regularization function applied to variances to ensure stability.

notes.text: To ensure the numerical stability and continuity guarantees of the N-particle algorithm are preserved when the swarm is highly converged (i.e., when the true variance $\sigma^2[f]$ is close to zero), this mechanism translates the regularized standard deviation from Chapter 1 to the mean-field level.

label: def-mean-field-z-scores
nl_definition: The mean-field Z-scores standardize the raw measurements using global, density-dependent moments for a particle at state z and a potential companion at state z_c at time t.

label: def-mean-field-fitness-potential
nl_definition: A functional of the density f that determines the fitness of a particle at state z relative to a companion at z_c by multiplicatively combining rescaled mean-field Z-scores for diversity and reward, balancing exploitation and exploration.

formal_conditions.text: V[f](z,z_c,t) := (g_A(\widetilde{d}[f](z,z_c,t)) + \eta)^\beta \cdot (g_A(\widetilde{r}[f](z,t)) + \eta)^\alpha

properties.name: Multiplicative Combination
properties.description: Combines contributions from reward and diversity channels multiplicatively to balance exploitation and exploration.

properties.name: Global Dependence
properties.description: Value at a point (z, z_c) depends on the global shape of the density f.

properties.name: Rescaling
properties.description: Applies the canonical Rescale Transformation g_A to mean-field Z-scores.

parameters.name: reward exponent
parameters.description: Exponent applied to the rescaled reward Z-score component.

parameters.name: diversity exponent
parameters.description: Exponent applied to the rescaled diversity Z-score component.

parameters.name: shift parameter
parameters.description: Additive shift to ensure non-negativity in rescaled values.

parameters.name: density
parameters.description: Probability density function over states.

parameters.name: particle state
parameters.description: State of the particle.

parameters.name: companion state
parameters.description: State of the companion particle.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Time parameter.

notes.text: The final fitness potential combines the contributions from the reward and diversity channels multiplicatively. This structure allows the algorithm to balance the drive for high rewards (exploitation) with the need to maintain diversity (exploration). The potential is a functional of the density f, denoted V[f], to emphasize that its value at a single point (z,z_c) depends on the global shape of the entire probability distribution.

label: def-baoab-update-rule
nl_definition: A symmetric five-step splitting scheme for updating the position and velocity of a particle in underdamped Langevin dynamics over a time step τ, combining deterministic force kicks, position drifts, and an exact Ornstein-Uhlenbeck solve for friction and noise.

formal_conditions.text: B-Step (Force Kick): Velocity updated with half-step kick from conservative force.
A-Step (Position Drift): Position updated with half-step drift using new velocity.
O-Step (Ornstein-Uhlenbeck): Velocity updated for full timestep solving OU process with flow field u at midpoint, friction, and Gaussian noise.
A-Step (Position Drift): Position updated with final half-step drift.
B-Step (Force Kick): Velocity updated with final half-step kick using force at new position.

properties.name: symmetric-composition
properties.description: Splits SDE into analytically solvable parts (B, A, O) and composes them symmetrically for improved accuracy and stability.

properties.name: exact-O-step
properties.description: Exactly solves the Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process for friction and thermal noise over the full timestep.

parameters.name: timestep
parameters.description: Time step size for the update.

parameters.name: mass
parameters.description: Particle mass.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Conservative force function F(x).

parameters.name: friction-coefficient
parameters.description: Friction coefficient in the Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process.

parameters.name: thermal-energy
parameters.description: Thermal energy parameter related to temperature.

parameters.name: noise
parameters.description: Standard Gaussian random vector ξ ~ N(0, I_d).

notes.text: Applies to the underdamped Langevin SDE driven by a standard Wiener process, with parameters from the Euclidean Gas specification.
u(x) is the flow field, typically the equilibrium velocity or mean field in the gas model.

label: def-kinetic-generator
nl_definition: The kinetic transport operator is the infinitesimal generator for the underdamped Langevin stochastic differential equations describing the continuous-time evolution of alive walkers in the phase space, approximated discretely by the BAOAB integrator, with reflecting boundary conditions on position and velocity.

formal_conditions.text: The SDE for position and velocity: dx_i = v_i dt, dv_i = (1/m F(x_i) - γ_fric (v_i - u(x_i))) dt + σ_v dW_t, where W_t is a standard d-dimensional Wiener process.
formal_conditions.latex: \mathrm d x_i = v_i\,\mathrm dt,\qquad \mathrm d v_i = \left(\frac{1}{m}F(x_i)-\gamma_{\mathrm{fric}}(v_i-u(x_i))\right)\,\mathrm dt \;+\; \sigma_v\,\mathrm dW_t

formal_conditions.text: Reflecting Position Boundary: Trajectories reflect at the boundary ∂X_valid, ensuring no mass leaves the domain through kinetic transport.
Reflecting Velocity Boundary: The dynamics are constrained to the velocity ball V_alg, modeled by a reflecting or squash boundary condition at ||v|| = V_alg mirroring the velocity cap ψ_v.

properties.name: Infinitesimal generator
properties.description: Acts on test functions f on the swarm state space as the Fokker-Planck operator for the N-particle system of independent SDEs over alive walkers A.

properties.name: Domain
properties.description: Phase space Ω with reflecting boundaries on position (∂X_valid) and velocity (V_alg).

properties.name: Form
properties.description: Sum over i in A of [v_i · ∇_{x_i} f + (m^{-1} F(x_i) - γ_fric (v_i - u(x_i))) · ∇_{v_i} f + (σ_v^2 / 2) Δ_{v_i} f].

parameters.name: mass
parameters.description: Particle mass

parameters.name: friction coefficient
parameters.description: Friction coefficient in the velocity update

parameters.name: target velocity
parameters.description: Target velocity function u(x_i)

parameters.name: velocity noise
parameters.description: Standard deviation of the velocity noise

parameters.name: algorithmic velocity cap
parameters.description: Maximum velocity norm for the velocity ball

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force function F(x_i)

parameters.name: Wiener process
parameters.description: Standard d-dimensional Wiener process

notes.text: This SDE is the continuous-time limit of the BAOAB integrator.
Applies between cloning events and death/revival transitions for alive walkers.
Position reflection ensures mass conservation; velocity reflection mimics the cap ψ_v.

label: def-killing-operator
nl_definition: The interior killing operator models death by removing mass from the alive density f at a position- and velocity-dependent rate c(z) f(z), where c is a smooth non-negative function that vanishes in safe interior regions and is positive near invalid boundaries, ensuring PDE regularity.

formal_conditions.text: c: Ω → [0, ∞), smooth and non-negative.
Safety in the interior: c(z) = 0 for all z in a safe subset of Ω away from the position boundary.
formal_conditions.latex: c(z) = 0 \, \forall z \in \text{safe subset of } \Omega \text{ away from position boundary}

formal_conditions.text: Activity near the boundary: c(z) > 0 in a smooth transition layer near ∂X_valid × V_alg.
formal_conditions.latex: c(z) > 0 \text{ in smooth transition layer near } \partial X_{\text{valid}} \times V_{\text{alg}}

formal_conditions.text: Smoothness: c ∈ C^∞(Ω) to ensure regularity of the PDE solutions.
formal_conditions.latex: c \in C^\infty(\Omega) \text{ to ensure PDE regularity}

properties.name: Killing Mechanism
properties.description: Removes mass from the alive density f at the rate c(z) f(z).

properties.name: Total Mass Killed Functional
properties.description: k_killed[f](t) := ∫_Ω c(z) f(t,z) dz, representing the total mass killed per unit time.

properties.name: Boundary Behavior
properties.description: c is zero in safe interiors and positive near invalid boundaries to model risk.

parameters.name: interior killing rate
parameters.description: A smooth, non-negative function mapping the domain to non-negative reals, modeling the killing rate.
constraints: c(z) = 0 for all z in a safe subset of Ω away from the position boundary
c(z) > 0 in a smooth transition layer near ∂X_valid × V_alg

parameters.name: alive density
parameters.description: The density function of alive agents at time t and state z.

notes.text: The smoothness of c ensures the regularity of solutions to the associated partial differential equations (PDEs) modeling the system.
This operator is used to enforce safety by penalizing states near invalid boundaries without abrupt killing.

label: def-revival-operator
nl_definition: A source term that re-injects mass from the dead population back into the alive population, with the spatial profile proportional to the current alive density, at a rate proportional to the dead mass.

formal_conditions.text: B[f, m_d](t, z) := λ_revive · m_d(t) · f(t,z)/m_a(t)
where m_d(t) = 1 - m_a(t)
and f(t,z)/m_a(t) is the normalized alive density

properties.name: Total mass revived per unit time
properties.description: The integral over the domain Ω of B[f, m_d](t,z) dz equals λ_revive · m_d(t)

parameters.name: revival rate
parameters.description: a free parameter independent of the timestep (typical values: 0.1-5)

notes.text: Models revival by cloning dead walkers from alive companions, mirroring the discrete algorithm where dead walkers select companions uniformly from the alive set and clone to their positions.
The mass killed by the killing operator flows into the dead reservoir, which acts as a source for revival.

label: def-cloning-generator
nl_definition: The Internal Cloning Operator S[f] is the mean-field limit of a discrete cloning mechanism in population dynamics, acting as a mass-neutral, non-local operator that decomposes into sink and source terms to redistribute mass within the alive population, distinct from revival processes.

formal_conditions.latex: S[f](t, z) = S_{\text{src}}[f](t, z) - S_{\text{sink}}[f](t, z)
S_{\text{src}}[f](t,z) = \frac{1}{\tau m_a(t)} \int_{\Omega} \int_{\Omega} f(t,z_d) f(t,z_c) P_{\text{clone}}[f/m_a](z_d, z_c) Q_{\delta}(z \mid z_c) \,\mathrm{d}z_d\,\mathrm{d}z_c

properties.name: mass-neutral
properties.description: \int_\Omega S[f](t,z) \,dz = 0 by construction, as source and sink integrals cancel.

properties.name: non-local
properties.description: Involves integrals over the entire domain \Omega, coupling distant states via cloning probabilities.

properties.name: distinct from revival
properties.description: Redistributes mass only within the alive population, unlike revival operators that transition from dead to alive states.

parameters.name: density
parameters.description: Alive population density function f(t,z)

parameters.name: timestep
parameters.description: Discrete timestep for rate conversion

parameters.name: alive mass
parameters.description: Total mass of alive population m_a(t) = \int_\Omega f(t,z) \,dz

parameters.name: cloning probability
parameters.description: Cloning probability depending on normalized density fitness P_{\text{clone}}[f/m_a](z_d, z_c)

parameters.name: jitter kernel
parameters.description: Displacement kernel for cloning, Gaussian in position and delta in velocity

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Spatial domain of the system

notes.text: Derived as the continuous-time rate limit (1/\tau) of discrete per-step cloning probabilities.
Mass neutrality proven by substituting the integral of Q_\delta = 1 and relabeling variables in the source-sink balance, yielding identical double integrals that subtract to zero.

label: def-transport-operator
nl_definition: The transport operator \(L^\dagger\) is the formal \(L^2\)-adjoint of the backward kinetic generator \(L\), acting on a probability density \(f\) in conservative form as the negative divergence of a probability flux vector \(J[f] = (J_x[f], J_v[f])\), where the flux components incorporate advection/drift and Fickian diffusion terms.

formal_conditions.text: L^\dagger is the formal L^2-adjoint of L
formal_conditions.latex: L^\dagger \text{ is the formal } L^2 \text{-adjoint of } L

formal_conditions.text:
L^\dagger f = -
abla \cdot J[f] = -
abla_x \cdot J_x[f] - 
abla_v \cdot J_v[f]
J_x[f] := v f - D_x \nabla_x f (Advection + Fickian Diffusion)
J_v[f] := A_v f - D_v \nabla_v f (Drift + Fickian Diffusion)

properties.name: Adjoint Property
properties.description: L^\dagger is the formal L^2-adjoint of the backward kinetic generator L

properties.name: Conservative Form
properties.description: Expressed as the negative divergence of the probability flux vector J[f]

properties.name: Positional Flux Component
properties.description: J_x[f] combines velocity-driven advection v f with positional Fickian diffusion -D_x \nabla_x f

properties.name: Velocity Flux Component
properties.description: J_v[f] combines velocity drift A_v f with velocity Fickian diffusion -D_v \nabla_v f

parameters.name: backward kinetic generator
parameters.description: The infinitesimal generator of the kinetic process acting on test functions, as defined in Section 2.2.

parameters.name: probability density
parameters.description: The density function on which the transport operator acts.

parameters.name: velocity
parameters.description: The velocity variable or field contributing to advection in position.

parameters.name: positional diffusion coefficient
parameters.description: The diffusion operator or tensor in the position variable.

parameters.name: velocity drift
parameters.description: The drift term acting in the velocity variable.

parameters.name: velocity diffusion coefficient
parameters.description: The diffusion operator or tensor in the velocity variable.

notes.text: This operator corresponds to the kinetic part of the evolution via the generator L_{kin}, representing local transport of probability density through drift and diffusion in the forward (Fokker-Planck) equation.
The backward kinetic generator L is defined in Section 2.2 (see def-kinetic-generator).
